humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle has three glyphs to represent different disasters, namely " 𡿧 " (flood), " disaster " (fire) and " 𢦔 " ( trooper disaster). (Shang Chengzuo) " Disaster " from "宀" from " fire " means fire. If there is a " fire " shape above the "宀" shape, it is suspected that it is also a " disaster ." (Refer to "New Oracle Bone Inscriptions", "Oracle Bone Inscriptions") Oracle is used as a place name, such as "Collection" 7968 reverse: "self disaster."

The character form of Xiaozhuan starts from " fire ", with a sound of " 𢦏 ". "Said Wen": "Xuan, Tianhuo said Xuan. From fire, sound of 𢦏. Disaster, or from 宀, fire. 𤆎, ancient text from talent. Disaster, from 𡿧." Or the body shape is similar to that of oracle bone inscriptions, paragraph Note: "The fire starts from the bottom, and burns it up." The籀 text form changes from " 𡿧 " to "火", and the official script omits the middle one next to " 𡿧 ", and is written as " disaster ".

The script on Jianbo once used " 𥘔 " to indicate disasters, from the sound of " show " to " cai ". Such as "Shanghai Bo Zhushu Five. "Three Virtues" Jane 2: "Tian Nai [Jiang Zhi] (Descending) 𥘔 (disaster)." "Mawangdui Silk Book. By law. "Mingli" line 74: "Yes must be blessings, not necessarily 𥘔 (disasters)."

There are many variants of " disaster " in ancient Chinese characters, and later it is written as " disaster " in handed down documents. " Disaster " means fire, as in "Spring and Autumn. "Fourteenth Year of Huan Gong": "Autumn and August, Ren Shen, protects against disasters." It also refers to various natural or man-made disasters, such as "Mandarin. "Zhou Yu": "In ancient times, natural disasters brought disasters, so they depended on the amount of money, the weight, and the weight to revive and save the people." Wei Zhao's note: "The disaster is the genus of the locust borer." "Zhuangzi. "Geng Sang Chu": "If it is, no misfortune will come, and no good will come. There is no good fortune, and there will be disasters for evil!"
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle from "宀" from " fire ", which means fire. The character form of Xiaozhuan starts from " fire ", with a sound of " 𢦏 ". The text form of 籀 changes from " 𡿧 " from "火", and the middle horizontal next to " 𡿧 " is omitted in the official script, and it is written as " disaster ".
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文有三種字形代表不同的災害，分別是「𡿧」（水災）、「灾」（火災）和「𢦔」（兵災）。（商承祚）「灾」從「宀」從「火」，表示火災。或有「火」形在「宀」形之上者，疑亦為「灾」。（參《新甲骨文編》、《甲骨文字編》）甲骨文用為地名，如《合集》7968反：「自灾。」

　　小篆字形從「火」，「𢦏」聲。《說文》：「烖，天火曰烖。从火，𢦏聲。灾，或从宀、火。𤆎，古文从才。災，籀文从𡿧。」或體字形與甲骨文構形相近，段注：「火起於下，焚其上也。」籀文字形從「𡿧」從「火」，隸書又省去「𡿧」旁中間的一橫，寫為「災」。

　　簡帛文字曾以「𥘔」表示災害，從「示」，「才」聲。如《上博竹書五．三德》簡2：「天乃[降止]（降）𥘔（災）。」《馬王堆帛書．經法．名理》第74行：「是必為福，非必為𥘔（災）。」

　　古文字表示災害的「災」的異體很多，後來在傳世文獻中大多寫作「災」。「災」既表示火災，如《春秋．桓公十四年》：「秋八月壬申，御廩災。」又泛指各種自然或人為的禍害，如《國語．周語》：「古者，天災降戾，於是乎量資幣，權輕重，以振救民。」韋昭注：「災，謂水旱蝗螟之屬。」《莊子．庚桑楚》：「若是者，禍亦不至，福亦不來。禍福無有，惡有人災也！」
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從「宀」從「火」，表示火災。小篆字形從「火」，「𢦏」聲。籀文字形從「𡿧」從「火」，隸書又省去「𡿧」旁中間的一橫，寫為「災」。
